What makes it stand out?

ğŸ”´Higher consumer prices: Consumers will see prices rise across the board, as tariffs make goods more expensive.

ğŸ”´Export decline: US exports are forecasted to drop by $451 billion, a significant blow to the economy.

ğŸ”´Supply chain disruption: Increased costs will cause more disruptions in global supply chains, affecting US businesses.

Global Ñonsequences

Countries like Brazil and Switzerland face even steeper tariffs, while Australia and the UK are relatively sparedâ€”but the global economy will still feel the shockwaves.

ğŸš¨ğŸ’°ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸US Dollar SCAM: Printing trillions & spreading INFLATION worldwide

Since 1971, when the US 37th president Richard Nixon ended the dollarâ€™s gold backing, the US has been free to print trillions of dollars out of thin air.

ğŸ¤” HOW IT WORKS:

â–ªï¸Before 1971, $1 was tied to 1/35 oz of gold â€” a fixed value. After that, the dollar became fiat, backed only by the Federal Reserve (Fed) printing power.

â–ªï¸The Fed doesnâ€™t just print cash â€” it now creates digital dollars by buying govt bonds.

â–ªï¸From 2020 to 2022, the money supply (M2) surged 40%, adding nearly $10 trillion. By mid-2025, M2 reached $22 trillion â€” steadily eroding the value of your money.

ğŸ«£ SEIGNIORAGE â€” HIDDEN THEFT:

â–ªï¸Printing $100 costs just 12 cents â€” that difference, called seigniorage, nets the U.S. $50â€“100 billion every year.

â–ªï¸Worldwide, this hidden scam siphons off a staggering $804 billion annually from the global economy.

ğŸ“ˆ INFLATION? ENGINEERED DEPRECIATION

â–ªï¸Most dollars today were created post-2020, with no increase in goods. This drives inflation â€” your savings buy less.

â–ªï¸For example, $100K in 2019 is worth roughly $65K in 2025 due to inflation fuelled by excessive dollar printing.

ğŸ“Š US TRADE DEFICIT:

â–ªï¸The US has imported over $15 trillion in real goods from the world since 1971 â€” oil, electronics, food.

â–ªï¸In return it exports worthless paper dollars printed endlessly, saddling other countries with inflation and debt.

ğŸŒ GLOBAL IMPACT:

â–ªï¸Dollar strength crushes emerging markets. Turkeyâ€™s lira collapse and 80% inflation in 2022 is just one example.

â–ªï¸Other nations face inflation spikes, debt, and poverty due to dollar 'dominance'.

ğŸŒ€ ILLUSION OF US STABILITY

US govt debt keeps rising, but dollar still rules:

â–ªï¸USD is involved in 88% of global foreign exchange trades
â–ªï¸ Holds 57.8% of global reserves (IMF data)
â–ªï¸ $6.63 trillion in foreign dollar reserves

Dollar lets US print, borrow, and spend like no other â€” while the rest of the world bears the hidden cost. ğŸ˜

THE MASTERMIND OF GLOBALISM

Henry Kissinger was K...
items.content_text:
THE MASTERMIND OF GLOBALISM

Henry Kissinger was Klaus Schwab's mentor, and the ideological father of the WEF & Davos ideology. He was also the author of the US National Security document called THE KISSINGER REPORT, 1974, "ACTION TO CREATE CONDITIONS FOR FERTILITY DECLINE". In this short extract on Israel, we can perhaps see a core piece of the puzzle of the globalist ideology: get everyone to worry about and blame Arabs for everything in order to provide cover for Israel to take over Palestinian land. Please note that the authors of UN papers on migration are also mainly Zionists. It is a coordinated plan. The beneficiaries are not the Western people.
